p: It was not possible to determine MBC for Bacillus subtilis due to its ability to produce spores, which would allow surviving the antibacterial activity of O. vulgare L. extracts. Spores are resistance structures formed by some bacterial genera that allow them to survive under different extreme conditions and chemical treatments [ 30]. However, it was not possible to detect antibacterial activity using the paper disk diffusion method (data not showed), probably due to the inaccuracy and lower sensitivity of this methodology compared to MIC and MBC method [ 31, 32].
